result.execSummary:
The defendant David D Nash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/18/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment, if needed.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court. No Violent contact will be considered only after the defendant has participated in 1/2 of his batterer's treatment. Defendant may have 3rd party contact to visit with his child/ren.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David D Nash

records.addlTxt:
Case was calendared today in another court.  There were no appearances.
Case removed from the calendar.  If the agent believes a hearing is necessary, he/she is to contact Judge Kremers court for a hearing.
cab

Defendant David D Nash in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Judge Kremers has agreed to hear this case for Judge Dallet, who is in trial.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment, if needed.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  No violent contact will be considered only after the defendant has participated in 1/2 of his batterer's treatment.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact to visit with his child/ren.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant David D Nash in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  The 9/21/15 jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant David D Nash in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  State is ready to proceed on the 911 call.  Defense objected.  Defense to file a brief with the court.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Tiffany W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David D Nash in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant David D Nash in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pretrial Conference scheduled May 11, 2015 at 8:30am, in Branch 40
